page.title: 03The Train Through Mulben
page.content: The railway line between Keith and Mulben is parallel to the road most of the way. Fourteen passenger trains and two goods trains go through each day. These trains carry about six thousand passengers in a year. There is a Railway Station at Keith. The line was first opened for passengers on 18th August 1858. Wnen it opened, it made the line from Aberdeen to Inverness complete. The Station at Mulben was also opened then,but it closed to passengers on 7th December 1960, and to goods on 20th April 1964. The Platform at Tauchers was for loading and unloading at Glentauchers Distillery. If you travel along this line on a train, you see some beautiful scenery.
